seg.seg: (Muktikā) says: After that, what did the Gautamid queen do? || Paṭṭinī says:
... I obtained great advantage, when together with so many women ... that ...
... in return for the advantages of the Law, I want to offer advantages in property.
… in return for the advantage[s] of the law, I should offer advantage[s] in property.
... (what) did she do? || Paṭṭinī says: She called the overseer of the ﬁelds, the kṣetrapati, and told him ...
(when) this ﬁeld has become ..., then you work it well and carefully. Then (?), I (will) because of the Buddha-god the teacher ...
(Which) field is provided with …, that you must till well and carefully!
... with a (smiling face), the lay woman says: Oh, Paṭṭinī, what did you say? Queen Gautamī, (with her) own (hands) ...
... precisely this indeed. I will tell you this: || In the Capicce [tune] || Not (for want) of means, nor of female servants, ...
I am telling you this, «…» (161)
... out of joy and love for the Buddha-god the teacher, has she herself made the jewel of a cotton cloth.
... whoever will give this cotton cloth as a gift to the Buddha-god the teacher, and from whom the Buddha-god the teacher (will receive) this (cotton cloth), ...

who(ever) gives this cotton cloth as a gift to the Buddha-god the teacher, and from whom the Buddha-god the teacher (will receive) this (cotton cloth), … he will also attain the ordination as an heir to the rank of Buddha. (161)
... he will also attain the ordination as an heir to the rank of Buddha. Thereafter (they) say this: ...
... no one will receive the ordination as an heir (to the rank of Buddha), except for the noble Metrak.
... he will also attain the ordination as an heir to the rank of Buddha. || Therefore then ...
… he will also attain the ordination as an heir to the rank of Buddha. (161)
... the (Buddha-god) the teacher will arrive in the city of Kapilavastu. || Then comes Ceṭikā, walking ...
... is arriving. || Paṭṭinī says: Ceṭikā, where were you? || Ceṭikā says:
then she orders me here to ask repeatedly: Ask when (with) the noble (son) ...
Paṭṭinī says: When queen Gautamī for the Buddha-god the teacher ...

p.note: This fragment contains part of the third act of the Maitreyasamitināṭaka; an Uy. parallel is MaitrHami 3, 4a17-5a17. See also 196-197.
The translation and the following commentary are adapted from 162.
This beginning corresponds to MaitrHami 3, 4 a 17, and the end of this leaf to MaitrHami 3, 5 a19.
The meaning of TA miṣi is here non-metaphorically ‘ﬁeld, arable land’, cf. 126.

The two words kākmärtik and kṣatrapai seem to refer to the same person; ﬁnal -ai, the reading of which is certain, in the latter term remains problematic. Since pai (with hiatus) is the Prakritic form of Skt. pati- ‘master’, one can suggest that kṣatrapai reﬂects the partial resanskritization of the Middle Indic form corresponding to a compound Skt. kṣetra-pati- ‘master of the ﬁelds’, of which TA miṣisā kākmärtik would be a gloss.
tme: the reading is certain, but the form may be slightly miswritten for tmaṃ, which ﬁts the context, for the beginning of a sentence.
niṣpaläntwaṣ: the expected form of the ablative plural is niṣpaläntwäṣ, but the reading is certain.
capiccenaṃ: a stanza of presumably 4 x 12 (5/7) syllables; the last syllable of the fourth pāda is to be restored on the ﬁrst line of the verso: probably the form of a demonstrative.
Cf. MaitrHami 3, 4 b19ff. The syllable kät has been left out by the scribe.
